meanings.definition: A metal bar with a hinged hook at one end, used to hold the strings of a piano in place.
meanings.sent1: The agraftes on the piano kept the strings securely in place.
meanings.sent2: The technician carefully adjusted the agraftes to ensure the piano's sound was perfect.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to play with the agraftes on the piano, creating a jingling melody.
meanings.sent4: Her fingers danced on the piano keys, while the agraftes held the harmony together.
meanings.sent5: The agraftes gleamed under the stage lights, adding a touch of elegance to the performance.

meanings.definition: A type of fastening device used in bookbinding.
meanings.sent1: The bookbinder used a delicate agraftes to secure the pages of the novel.
meanings.sent2: The agraftes made it easy to flip through the pages of the handmade book.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten batted at the agraftes on the book, causing it to open unexpectedly.
meanings.sent4: Her love for reading was like an agraftes, binding her to the stories forever.
meanings.sent5: The agraftes on the antique book were rusted, hinting at the passage of time.

meanings.definition: A type of decorative metal ornament used in jewelry making.
meanings.sent1: The jeweler crafted intricate agraftes to adorn the necklace.
meanings.sent2: The agraftes added a touch of sophistication to the bracelet design.
meanings.sent3: The agraftes on the earrings sparkled like tiny stars in the night sky.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as bright as the agraftes on the ring she wore.
meanings.sent5: The agraftes on the brooch were shaped like delicate flowers, enhancing its beauty.
